ayas.translation: Woe to the defrauders,

bismillah.translation: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.

ayas.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ٱكْتَالُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ يَسْتَوْفُونَ
ayas.translation: Who, when they take the measure (of their dues) from men take it fully,
But when they measure out to others or weigh out for them, they are deficient.
ayas.transliteration: wa idhā kālūhum aw wazanūhum yukhsirūn

ayas.translation: Do not these think that they shall be raised again
For a mighty day,
The day on which men shall stand before the Lord of the worlds?

ayas.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلْفُجَّارِ لَفِى سِجِّينٍ
ayas.translation: Nay! most surely the record of the wicked is in the Sijjin.
ayas.transliteration: kallā inna kitābal fujjāri lafī sijjīn

ayas.translation: And what will make you know what the Sijjin is?
It is a written book.
Woe on that day to the rejecters,
Who give the lie to the day of judgment.

ayas.arabic: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِۦٓ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
ayas.translation: And none gives the lie to it but every exceeder of limits, sinful one
ayas.transliteration: wa mā yukadhhibu bihi illā kullu mu`tadin athīm

ayas.arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
ayas.translation: When Our communications are recited to him, he says: Stories of those of yore.

ayas.arabic: كَلَّا ۖ بَلْ ۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
ayas.translation: Nay! rather, what they used to do has become like rust upon their hearts.
ayas.transliteration: kallā ۖ bal ۜ rāna `alā qulūbihim mā kānū yaksibūn

ayas.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُمْ عَن رَّبِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَّمَحْجُوبُونَ
ayas.translation: Nay! most surely they shall on that day be debarred from their Lord.
Then most surely they shall enter the burning fire.

ayas.arabic: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
ayas.translation: Then shall it be said: This is what you gave the lie to.
ayas.transliteration: thumma yuqālu hādhal ladhī kuntum bihi tukadhhibūn

ayas.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلْأَبْرَارِ لَفِى عِلِّيِّينَ
ayas.translation: Nay! Most surely the record of the righteous shall be in the Iliyin.
And what will make you know what the highest Iliyin is?
It is a written book,
Those who are drawn near (to Allah) shall witness it.
Most surely the righteous shall be in bliss,
On thrones, they shall gaze;
You will recognize in their faces the brightness of bliss.
They are made to quaff of a pure drink that is sealed (to others).

ayas.arabic: خِتَـٰمُهُۥ مِسْكٌ ۚ وَفِى ذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَتَنَافَسِ ٱلْمُتَنَـٰفِسُونَ
ayas.translation: The sealing of it is (with) musk; and for that let the aspirers aspire.
ayas.transliteration: khitāmuhu misk ۚ wafī dhālika falyatanāfasil mutanāfisūn

ayas.translation: And the admixture of it is a water of Tasnim,
A fountain from which drink they who are drawn near (to Allah).

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا۟ كَانُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ يَضْحَكُونَ
ayas.translation: Surely they who are guilty used to laugh at those who believe.
ayas.transliteration: innal ladhīna ajramū kānū minal ladhīna āmanū yaḍ-ḥakūn

ayas.translation: And when they passed by them, they winked at one another.

ayas.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُوا۟ فَكِهِينَ
ayas.translation: And when they returned to their own followers they returned exulting.

ayas.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوْهُمْ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَضَآلُّونَ
ayas.translation: And when they saw them, they said: Most surely these are in error;
ayas.transliteration: wa idhā ra-awhum qālū inna hā-ulā-i laḍāllūn

ayas.translation: And they were not sent to be keepers over them.

ayas.arabic: فَٱلْيَوْمَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْكُفَّارِ يَضْحَكُونَ
ayas.translation: So today those who believe shall laugh at the unbelievers;
ayas.transliteration: fal yawmal ladhīna āmanū minal kuffāri yaḍ-ḥakūn

ayas.translation: On thrones, they will look.

ayas.arabic: هَلْ ثُوِّبَ ٱلْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْعَلُونَ
ayas.translation: Surely the disbelievers are rewarded as they did.
ayas.transliteration: hal thuwwibal kuffāru mā kānū yaf`alūn
